items.title: Update PyPi Release
items.body: Would you consider publishing this package to PyPi for `pip install ...`?

items.title: version 0.4 broken when using venv with Python 3.x
items.body:
I just tested this, both on Ubuntu 18.04 and CentOS 7.6.1810, with the same results:

```
(venv) [vagrant@localhost siebel-crash-report]$ pytest
==================================================================================== test session starts =====================================================================================
platform linux -- Python 3.6.3, pytest-4.2.0, py-1.7.0, pluggy-0.8.1
rootdir: /home/vagrant/siebel-crash-report, inifile:
collected 0 items / 1 errors                                                                                                                                                                 

=========================================================================================== ERRORS ===========================================================================================
__________________________________________________________________ ERROR collecting tests/siebel/maintenance/test_thread.py __________________________________________________________________
ImportError while importing test module '/home/vagrant/siebel-crash-report/tests/siebel/maintenance/test_thread.py'.
Hint: make sure your test modules/packages have valid Python names.
Traceback:
tests/siebel/maintenance/test_thread.py:1: in <module>
    from siebel.maintenance.crash import fix_thread_id
src/siebel/maintenance/crash.py:6: in <module>
    from iniparse import INIConfig
venv/lib64/python3.6/site-packages/iniparse/__init__.py:6: in <module>
    from ini import INIConfig, change_comment_syntax
E   ModuleNotFoundError: No module named 'ini'
!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!! Interrupted: 1 errors during collection !!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!
================================================================================== 1 error in 0.12 seconds ===================================================================================
(venv) [vagrant@localhost siebel-crash-report]$ pip show iniparse
Name: iniparse
Version: 0.4
Summary: Accessing and Modifying INI files
Home-page: http://code.google.com/p/iniparse/
Author: Paramjit Oberoi
Author-email: param@cs.wisc.edu
License: MIT
Location: /home/vagrant/siebel-crash-report/venv/lib/python3.6/site-packages
Requires: 
Required-by: 
(venv) [vagrant@localhost siebel-crash-report]$
```

Now, if I go out the venv and install `iniparse` globally (at least for Ubuntu there is a DEB package for that, couldn't find for CentOS though), I can start a interactive session and import the module without the same exception:

```
$ python3.6 -V
Python 3.6.7
alceu@yggdrasil:~/Projetos/siebel-crash-report$ python3.6
Python 3.6.7 (default, Oct 22 2018, 11:32:17) 
[GCC 8.2.0] on linux
Type "help", "copyright", "credits" or "license" for more information.
>>> from iniparse import INIConfig
>>> 
```

As soon as I create a new venv and try to repeat those steps, same errors occur. I can't install `ini` either:

```
$ python3.6 -m venv venv
$ source venv/bin/activate
(venv) $ pip install --upgrade pip
Cache entry deserialization failed, entry ignored
Collecting pip
  Using cached https://files.pythonhosted.org/packages/d7/41/34dd96bd33958e52cb4da2f1bf0818e396514fd4f4725a79199564cd0c20/pip-19.0.2-py2.py3-none-any.whl
Installing collected packages: pip
  Found existing installation: pip 9.0.1
    Uninstalling pip-9.0.1:
      Successfully uninstalled pip-9.0.1
Successfully installed pip-19.0.2
(venv) $ pip install -r requirements-3x.txt 
Collecting atomicwrites==1.3.0 (from -r requirements-3x.txt (line 1))
  Using cached https://files.pythonhosted.org/packages/52/90/6155aa926f43f2b2a22b01be7241be3bfd1ceaf7d0b3267213e8127d41f4/atomicwrites-1.3.0-py2.py3-none-any.whl
Collecting attrs==18.2.0 (from -r requirements-3x.txt (line 2))
  Using cached https://files.pythonhosted.org/packages/3a/e1/5f9023cc983f1a628a8c2fd051ad19e76ff7b142a0faf329336f9a62a514/attrs-18.2.0-py2.py3-none-any.whl
Collecting configparser==3.7.1 (from -r requirements-3x.txt (line 3))
  Using cached https://files.pythonhosted.org/packages/43/63/220afe02a0d302c2244309b1dce3d884a865be65c7d8148ededfc0c29c31/configparser-3.7.1-py3-none-any.whl
Collecting entrypoints==0.3 (from -r requirements-3x.txt (line 4))
  Using cached https://files.pythonhosted.org/packages/ac/c6/44694103f8c221443ee6b0041f69e2740d89a25641e62fb4f2ee568f2f9c/entrypoints-0.3-py2.py3-none-any.whl
Collecting enum34==1.1.6 (from -r requirements-3x.txt (line 5))
  Using cached https://files.pythonhosted.org/packages/af/42/cb9355df32c69b553e72a2e28daee25d1611d2c0d9c272aa1d34204205b2/enum34-1.1.6-py3-none-any.whl
Collecting flake8==3.7.5 (from -r requirements-3x.txt (line 6))
```

items.title: Dead code in RawConfigParser.get
items.body:
This parser is packaged in Fedora as python3-iniparse-0.4-32.fc29.noarch and used by dnf for which I'm currently writing some plugin code. I was looking at the sources, hoping to find a way to provide default values to `.get()`, to avoid having the `configparser.NoOptionError` exception raised.

Looking at https://github.com/candlepin/python-iniparse/blob/d336b8d7ac0c546815aeae0d0c3ecc24228e6ff0/iniparse/compat.py#L118-L125 I'm surprised that value is assigned to `value` with `value = vars[option]` but `value` then does not seem to be used at all. And it then looks like `vars` is not used at all either.

Could you clarify what the code does, or remove it?
